Jx.Store

Extends: Jx.Object

This class is the store.  It keeps track of data.  It allows adding, deleting, iterating, sorting etc...

For the most part the store is pretty “dumb” meaning it starts with very limited functionality.  Actually, it can’t even load data by itself.  Instead, it needs to have protocols, strategies, and a record class passed to it that it can use.

Example

Summary
Jx.StoreExtends: Jx.Object
Options
idthe identifier for this store
columnsan array listing the columns of the store in order of their appearance in the data object formatted as an object {name: ‘column name’, type: ‘column type’} where type can be one of alphanumeric, numeric, date, boolean, or currency.
protocolThe protocol to use for communication in this store. 
strategiesThis is an array of instantiated strategy objects that will work on this store. 
recordThis is a Jx.Store.Record instance or one of its subclasses. 
recordOptionsOptions to pass to each record as it’s created.
Properties
idThe id of this store.

moveToMoves the index to a specific record in the store
eachallows iteration through the store’s records. 
getgets the data for the specified column
setSets the passed data for a particular column on the indicated record.
refreshSimply fires the storeRefresh event for strategies to listen for.

addRecordsUsed to add multiple records to the store at one time.
getRecordReturns the record at the given index or the current store index
replaceRecordReplaces the record at an existing index with a new record containing the passed in data.

Functions
insertRecordShortcut to addRecord which facilitates marking a record as inserted.
getColumnsAllows retrieving the columns array
findByColumnUsed to find a specific record by the value in a specific column. 
removeRecordremoves (but does not mark for deletion) a record at the given index or the current store index if none is passed in.
removeRecordsUsed to remove multiple contiguous records from a store.
parseTemplateparses the provided template to determine which store columns are required to complete it.
fillTemplateActually does the work of getting the data from the store and creating a single item based on the provided template



Options



id
the identifier for this store



columns
an array listing the columns of the store in order of their appearance in the data object formatted as an object {name: ‘column name’, type: ‘column type’} where type can be one of alphanumeric, numeric, date, boolean, or currency.



protocol
The protocol to use for communication in this store.  The store itself doesn’t actually use it but it is accessed by the strategies to do their work.  This option is required and the store won’t work without it.



strategies
This is an array of instantiated strategy objects that will work on this store.  They provide many services such as loading data, paging data, saving, and sorting (and anything else you may need can be written).  If none are passed in it will use the default Jx.Store.Strategy.Full



record
This is a Jx.Store.Record instance or one of its subclasses.  This is the class that will be used to hold each individual record in the store.  Don’t pass in a instance of the class but rather the class name itself.  If none is passed in it will default to Jx.Record



recordOptions
Options to pass to each record as it’s created.



Properties



id
The id of this store.



Functions



getStrategy
getStrategy: function (name)
returns the named strategy if it is present, null otherwise.
Parameters
namethe name of the strategy we’re looking for



addStrategy
addStrategy: function (strategy)
Allows the addition of strategies after store initialization.  Handy to have if some other class needs a strategy that is not present.
Parameters
strategythe strategy to add to the store



load
load: function (params)
used to load the store.  It simply fires an event that the strategies are listening for.
Parameters
paramsa hash of parameters passed to the strategy for determining what records to load.



empty
empty: function ()
Clears the store of data



hasNext
hasNext : function ()
Determines if there are more records past the current one.
Returns: true | false (Null if there’s a problem)



hasPrevious
hasPrevious : function ()
Determines if there are records before the current one.
Returns: true | false



valid
valid : function ()
Tells us if the current index has any data (i.e. that the index is valid).
Returns: true | false



next
next : function ()
Moves the store to the next record
Returns: nothing | null if error



previous
previous : function ()
moves the store to the previous record
Returns: nothing | null if error



first
first : function ()
Moves the store to the first record
Returns: nothing | null if error



last
last : function ()
Moves to the last record in the store
Returns: nothing | null if error



count
count : function ()
Returns the number of records in the store
Returns: an integer indicating the number of records in the store or null if there’s an error



getPosition
getPosition : function ()
Tells us where we are in the store
Returns: an integer indicating the position in the store or null if there’s an error



moveTo
moveTo : function (index)
Moves the index to a specific record in the store
Parameters
indexthe record to move to
Returns: trueif successful false - if not successful null - on error



each
each: function (fn,
bind,
ignoreDeleted)
allows iteration through the store’s records.  NOTE: this function is untested
Parameters
fnthe function to execute for each record
bindthe scope of the function
ignoreDeletedflag that tells the function whether to ignore records marked as deleted.



get
get: function (column,
index)
gets the data for the specified column
Parameters
columnindicator of the column to set.  Either a string (the name of the column) or an integer (the index of the column in the record).
indexthe index of the record in the internal array.  Optional. defaults to the current index.



set
set: function (column,
data,
index)
Sets the passed data for a particular column on the indicated record.
Parameters
columnindicator of the column to set.  Either a string (the name of the column) or an integer (the index of the column in the record).
datathe data to set in the column of the record
indexthe index of the record in the internal array.  Optional. defaults to the current index.



refresh
refresh: function ()
Simply fires the storeRefresh event for strategies to listen for.



addRecord
addRecord: function (data,
position,
insert)
Adds given data to the end of the current store.
Parameters
dataThe data to use in creating a record.  This should be in whatever form Jx.Store.Record, or the current subclass, needs it in.
positionwhether the record is added to the ‘top’ or ‘bottom’ of the store.
insertflag whether this is an “insert”



addRecords
addRecords: function (data,
position)
Used to add multiple records to the store at one time.
Parameters
dataan array of data to add.
position’top’ or ‘bottom’.  Indicates whether to add at the top or the bottom of the store



getRecord
getRecord: function (index)
Returns the record at the given index or the current store index
Parameters
indexthe index from which to return the record.  Optional.  Defaults to the current store index



replaceRecord
Replaces the record at an existing index with a new record containing the passed in data.
Parameters
datathe data to use in creating the new record
indexthe index at which to place the new record.  Optional. defaults to the current store index.



deleteRecord
deleteRecord: function(index)
Marks a record for deletion and removes it from the regular array of records.  It adds it to a special holding array so it can be disposed of later.
Parameters
indexthe index at which to place the new record.  Optional. defaults to the current store index.



TODO



I moved this to a property that is always an array so I don’t
get an error in the save strategy. if (!$defined(this.deleted)) { this.deleted = []; }



Functions



insertRecord
insertRecord: function (data,
position)
Shortcut to addRecord which facilitates marking a record as inserted.
Parameters
datathe data to use in creating this inserted record.  Should be in whatever form the current implementation of Jx.Record needs
positionwhere to place the record.  Should be either ‘top’ or ‘bottom’.



getColumns
getColumns: function ()
Allows retrieving the columns array



findByColumn
findByColumn: function (column,
value)
Used to find a specific record by the value in a specific column.  This is particularly useful for finding records by a unique id column.  The search will stop on the first instance of the value
Parameters
columnthe name (or index) of the column to search by
valuethe value to look for



removeRecord
removeRecord: function (index)
removes (but does not mark for deletion) a record at the given index or the current store index if none is passed in.
Parameters
indexOptional.  The store index of the record to remove.



removeRecords
removeRecords: function (first,
last)
Used to remove multiple contiguous records from a store.
Parameters
firstwhere to start removing records (zero-based)
lastwhere to stop removing records (zero-based, inclusive)



parseTemplate
parseTemplate: function (template)
parses the provided template to determine which store columns are required to complete it.
Parameters
templatethe template to parse



fillTemplate
fillTemplate: function (index,
template,
columnsNeeded,
obj)
Actually does the work of getting the data from the store and creating a single item based on the provided template
Parameters
indexthe index of the data in the store to use in populating the template.
templatethe template to fill
columnsNeededthe array of columns needed by this template. should be obtained by calling parseTemplate().
objan object with some prefilled keys to use in substituting.  Ones that are also in the store will be overwritten.









Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.
